text_result.title: Sucrose - Wikipedia for Schools
text_result.fulltxt:
<ul>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> monosaccharides α- glucose and fructose joined by a glycosidic bond between carbon atom 1 of the glucose unit and carbon atom 2 of the fructose unit What is notable about sucrose is that unlike most polysaccharides the glycosidic bond is formed <strong>  . . .</strong></li>
 <li><strong>. . . </strong> further bonding to other saccharide units Since it contains no free anomeric carbon atom it is classified as a nonreducing sugar Sucrose melts and decomposes at 186 °C to form caramel and when combusted produces carbon carbon dioxide and water <strong>. . . </strong></li>
 </ul>
